column7: Mars is the fourth closest planet to the Sun. Mars takes about

column9: the Earth with a diameter of 6,792km. However its mass is only

column7: Venus is the second closest planet to the Sun and orbits in an
column8: almost circular orbit at 108 million km. As it orbits, Venus
column9: comes closer to Earth than any other planet in the solar system
column10: and can come to within about 40 million km.

column7: Neptune is the eighth closest planet to the Sun and is (since the
column8: relegation of Pluto) the last Planet in the Solar System. It is
column9: similar in size and composition to Uranus with a diameter of
column10: 49,000km and a mass of over 17 times that of Earth.

column7: Saturn is the sixth closest planet to the Sun. It is the second
column8: largest planet in the solar system having a radius 9 times that
column9: of Earth (57,000 km) and a mass 95 times that of Earth. Saturn
column10: orbits the Sun once very 29 years (at about 1400 million km)
column11: and is mainly comprised of gas (96% hydrogen and 3% helium).
